column5: Scopus / WoS / UGC-CARE / Vidwan / Institute Website / IRINS
column6:
Excellent (27–30): ? 2.5 indexed journal papers per faculty/year (rolling 3-year avg) and annual growth ?10%
Good (21–26): 1.5 to <2.5 indexed papers/year — growth ?5%
Average (11–20): 0.75 to <1.5 indexed papers/year — growth <5%
Poor (0–10): <0.75 indexed papers/year OR mostly non-indexed publications

Excellent (45–50): Average citations ?10 per paper (last 3–5 years) AND h-index ?15
Good (35–44): Citations 5–9 per paper AND h-index 10–14
Average (20–34): Citations 2–4 per paper AND h-index 5–9
Poor (0–19): Citations <2 per paper OR h-index <5

column5: Funding agency websites, Institute reports, Scopus / IRINS
column6:
Excellent (27–30): ? ?2 Cr total funding; ?5 active external projects from major agencies; valid sanction & UC documents
Good (21–26): ?50 L–2 Cr funding; 2–4 active projects; mix of government/industry sponsors
Average (11–20): ?10–50 L funding; 1–2 minor projects; mostly government-only support
Poor (0–10): <?10 L or no external funded projects; no valid documentation

Excellent (17–20): ?10 active collaborative projects/MoUs with industry/academia in last 3 years AND tangible outputs
Good (13–16): 5–9 collaborations or MoUs AND some output
Average (7–12): 2–4 collaborations/MoUs; limited output
Poor (0–6): <2 collaborations/MoUs OR no documented output

Excellent (25–30): 90th percentile based on National / State exams
Good (20–24): 75th percentile based on National / State exams
Average (10–19): 50th percentile based on National / State exams
Poor (0–9): below 50th percentile

Excellent (27 –30): ?1:20 (AICTE compliant across all programs); ratio verified from approved faculty list in AICTE portal; stable staffing over 3 years.

Average (11–20): 1:26–30; moderate faculty shortage or temporary/contractual dependence.
Poor (0–10): >1:30; significant vacancies or non-compliance with AICTE norms.

Average (1): 5–14% faculty
Poor (0): <5% or none

Excellent (9-10): ?90% pass rate across all programs; consistent upward trend or stable >90% for 3 years.
Good (7-8): 80–89% pass rate; minor year-to-year variation (<5%)
Average (4-6): 65–79% pass rate; moderate variation (5–10% fluctuation)
Poor (0–3): <65% pass rate; inconsistent or declining results

Excellent (8–10):
?5 well-maintained sports facilities (indoor + outdoor), modern equipment, dedicated grounds/courts, year-round accessibility.

Good (6–7):
3–4 functional facilities, adequate equipment, regular student access.

Average (3–5):
1–2 basic facilities, limited equipment, shared or constrained access.

Poor (0–2):
No dedicated sports facilities or severely inadequate infrastructure.

Excellent (8–10):
Regular participation at state and national levels across multiple sports, annual representation.

Good (6–7):
Consistent inter-college and occasional state-level participation.

Average (3–5):
Occasional inter-college tournaments, irregular participation.

Poor (0–2):
Rare or no participation in organized tournaments.

Excellent (4–5):
Multiple podium finishes or titles at state/national level in recent years.

Good (3):
Recognized wins or top finishes at inter-college or district level.

Average (1–2):
Participation certificates or isolated minor achievements.

Poor (0):
No notable or recorded sports achievements.

Excellent (13–15): ?10 active clubs with ?2 events/semester.
Good (10–12): 6–9 clubs, periodic events.
Average (6–9): 3–5 clubs, irregular activity.
Poor (0–5): <3 clubs, low engagement.

column5: QS/THE ranking, NIRF Perception score, media citations

column5: NBA Portal, AICTE Approved List, IQAC Reports, institute website
column6:
Excellent (9–10): ?75% of eligible UG/PG programs accredited (valid, not expired); includes core engineering branches; ?2 accreditation cycles completed.
Good (7–8): 50–74% of eligible programs accredited; valid accreditation cycle ongoing; renewal or reapplication in progress.
Average (4–6): 25–49% programs accredited or under NBA review (Applied/Visit Scheduled); mostly first-time accreditations.
Poor (0–3): <25% programs accredited OR accreditation expired/not renewed; no active NBA process.
